title: U.S. FDA approves AstraZeneca's diabetes drug for treating heart failure risk
text:
FILE PHOTO: A man walks past a sign at an AstraZeneca site in Macclesfield, England May 19, 2014. REUTERS/Phil Noble/File Photo

(Reuters) - AstraZeneca Plc (AZN.L) said on Monday U.S. regulators approved its diabetes drug Farxiga to be used as a treatment to reduce the chances of hospitalisation for heart failure in adults with type-2 diabetes and other cardiovascular risks.

The approval by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration is based on results from the DECLARE-TIMI 58 clinical trial, the British drugmaker said and follows a similar approval here by the European authorities in August.

Diabetes is associated with a high risk of heart failure.
